metadata.title: CVE-2022-3328 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - high.
metadata.description:
Race condition in snap-confine's must_mkdir_and_open_with_perms() The Qualys Research Team discovered that a race condition existed in the snapd snap-confine binary when preparing the private /tmp mount for a snap. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3328` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

snap-confine - 2.57.5+22.10ubuntu0.1
snapd - 2.57.5+22.10ubuntu0.1
snapd-xdg-open - 2.57.5+22.10ubuntu0.1
ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.57.5+22.10ubuntu0.1
ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.57.5+22.10ubuntu0.1
ubuntu-snappy - 2.57.5+22.10ubuntu0.1
ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.57.5+22.10ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.note: alexmurray> vuln introduced as part of the fix for CVE-2021-44731 - as such affects upstream versions 2.54.3 to 2.57.5

criterions.comment: snapd package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.57.5+22.10ubuntu0.1').
